name:
  ClimaShield
timeline:
  Nov - Dec 2025
context:
  Developed during the PCCOE IGC 2026 Hackathon. Cleared the first round with an idea and presentation and built a working prototype for the second round. Final round results are pending.
objective:
  To predict climate-related risks before they occur and provide early guidance to individuals and communities.
current_status:
  The Best Project till date , Working prototype
implemented_features:
  7-day weather prediction
  Prediction of 7 different climate-related disasters using separate neural network models
  Disease risk estimation linked to climate conditions
  Location-based and personalized advisory system
  AI assistant to explain risks and suggested actions
  Background monitoring agent that continuously evaluates climate conditions and triggers alerts
concept_or_partial_features:
  Community-level alert distribution system
technical_approach:
  Used multiple neural networks, each trained for a specific disaster type, combined with application-level logic to generate predictions and advisories. A background agent monitors conditions continuously and interacts with users through alerts and an AI assistant.
tech_stack:
  frontend:
    React Native (Expo)
  authentication_and_alerts:
    Firebase
  machine_learning:
    TensorFlow
  language_model_for_advice:
    LLaMA
  backend:
    Python and Node.js
  apis:
    Flask-based APIs
key_challenges:
  Lack of clean and reliable real-world datasets for disaster prediction
  Training and validating neural networks with limited data
data_strategy:
  Used synthetic data to train neural network models due to the unavailability of suitable real-world datasets.
learning_outcomes:
  Data quality strongly influences model performance
  System integration is as important as individual model accuracy
links:
  https://github.com/Pratham9911/ClimaShield

name:
  InfinityAR
timeline:
  Feb–Apr 2025
context:
  Developed as part of a second-year Project Based Learning (PBL) course, where teams were required to design and complete a project within a fixed academic deadline.
objective:
  To explore the use of augmented reality for improving visualization and engagement in educational content.
current_status:
  Working prototype
implemented_features:
  AR visualization of all planets in the solar system
  Interactive 3D planet models viewable in AR
  Marker-based AR using target images to render 3D content
  Support for low-end Android devices
concept_or_partial_features:
  Integration of the system into school education using customized textbooks as AR targets
technical_approach:
  Built a marker-based augmented reality application where users point their mobile device at a predefined image target to render and interact with 3D planetary models. The focus was on maintaining performance while enabling interaction on low-end devices.
tech_stack:
  game_engine:
    Unity 3D
  programming_language:
    C#
  3d_modeling:
    Blender
  platform:
    Android
  development_tools:
    Android Studio
  backend_services:
    Firebase
key_challenges:
  Learning multiple new tools and frameworks within a short timeframe
  Managing coordination and task division within a team project
learning_outcomes:
  Hands-on experience with augmented reality development
  Understanding performance constraints in mobile AR applications
recognition:
  The project idea was later presented in the college Entrepreneurship Challenge, where it won twice for its educational application concept.
links:
  https://infinityar.vercel.app/

name:
  RAG-based Personal Portfolio
timeline:
  Dec 2025
context:
  Started after attending a discussion where AI interns shared their experiences. One of them mentioned using a chatbot to explain their profile, which inspired the idea of building a portfolio that can explain itself using AI.
objective:
  To build a personal portfolio that can answer questions about skills, projects, and experience using a retrieval-based AI system.
current_status:
  Working prototype
implemented_features:
  Retrieval-based question answering over personal profile and projects
  AI-generated explanations about background, skills, and work
concept_or_partial_features:
  Continuous improvement of responses based on better data structuring
  Expanding conversational abilities beyond portfolio information
technical_approach:
  Built a retrieval-augmented generation system where structured portfolio data is retrieved and passed to a language model to generate accurate and context-aware responses about the profile.
tech_stack:
  frontend:
    Next.js
  backend:
    Node.js
  language_model:
    LLaMA
  architecture:
    Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
key_challenges:
  Designing a clean and non-redundant data structure for personal information
  Preventing over-claiming or hallucinated responses by the AI
learning_outcomes:
  Understanding how RAG systems behave with structured personal data
  Importance of precise data design for controllable AI responses
links:
  https://github.com/Pratham9911/RAG-Portfolio

context:
  Learning and building with unfamiliar technologies
difficulty:
  Many projects involved tools and domains that were completely new, which led to frequent failures and unexpected behavior during development.
how_it_affected_me:
  Progress was slow at times and often required restarting parts of the implementation after long debugging sessions.
how_i_handled_it:
  Reduced scope and complexity by first building smaller prototypes or following focused tutorials, then gradually expanding toward the full system.
what_i_learned:
  Breaking complex goals into smaller working parts makes learning faster and reduces repeated failures.

context:
  Early AI and neural network experimentation
difficulty:
  Initial models performed poorly due to limited data quality and incomplete understanding of training and evaluation.
how_it_affected_me:
  Results were frustrating and did not match expectations despite significant time investment.
how_i_handled_it:
  Shifted focus to fundamentals such as data preparation, model evaluation, and testing on smaller datasets before scaling.
what_i_learned:
  Model performance depends more on data quality and understanding than on model complexity.

context:

what_i_learned:
